Core - Using options

Demonstration of setting up a basic map with base layers, an initial zoom level, and a center position. Zoom and center position are also bound as inputs, so changes are reflected when you hit apply.

Simple Base Layers

Simple map setup with multiple base layers. This approach will automatically show the layers control so you can switch between base layers.

Layers and Layer Controls

Advanced example showing how to add/remove arbitrary layers to the map using the layers input binding and the layers control.

Markers

Markers are just like any other layer. You can add them to a map by creating them and adding them to an array bound to the layers input.

Efficient Change Detection

We currently use iterable and key/value differs to track changes to allow mutable changes to the bound objects/arrays. This can become inefficient for large layer arrays. There are several strategies for mitigating this performance impact. First, you can wrap the directive in a compoment that uses the OnPush change detection strategy. Second, you can wrap large sets of layers (e.g., markers) in layer groups to keep the bound array size small. This example shows how to use OnPush to improve change detection efficiency. See the README for more details.
